cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi SW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west across the Florida Straits tonight, then turning WNW and NW into the east-central Gulf of Mexico Monday–Tuesday, and is forecast to arc toward the Florida Big Bend and cross the peninsula Thursday before emerging off the Southeast U.S. coast.

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys through the Florida Big Bend, then the Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (8% cumulative) for sustained tropical-storm-force winds; any gusts most likely Wednesday night–Thursday and expected to remain below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected along the Mobile Bay coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 1–3 inches of rain late Wednesday through Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents in the near-shore approaches beginning mid-week may hamper small-craft operations.
